pullRequest.body:
It doesn't make a lot of sense for `factors` to require a `DecidableEq` assumption since it's not used in the statement, and the definition is already noncomputable. This PR removes that assumption and updates some lemmas later in the file accordingly.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
LGTM, thanks!

Please fix the linter errors.

bors d+

:v: timotree3 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8296503917/job/22705650742)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8296503917/job/22705650945)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8296503917/job/22705650527)

When fixing the "unused DecidableEq" warnings I ended up noticing that there were more unnecessary `DecidableEq` assumptions in this file. Now the diff has increased significantly, so you might want to review again

Thanks for removing unnecessary `DecidableEq` instances!

`open classical in` seems fine for definitions, but for theorems we should use the `classical` tactic inside the proof, to be sure that we're not accidentally poisoning the theorem statement with classical instances.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: remove DecidableEq assumption from `factors`
